title: Correlation Coefficient for Scatterplot
question_text: The approximate correlation of the data is $r =$ ?
solution:
Remember the correlation coefficient, r, represents only linear data. Although this data does show a clear pattern, it is not even close to linear (straight line) form. Therefore, the correlation will be exactly zero for data such as this.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'A'.

Correlations of -0.1 will show a very weak negative linear correlation, while correlations of -0.5 will show a moderately weak negative linear correlation.
